meanings.definition: To promote or advertise a product or service before it is officially released for sale.
meanings.sent1: The company premarketed their new video game to build excitement before the launch.
meanings.sent2: It is common for companies to premarket their upcoming products to generate interest.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel premarketed his nut-gathering skills to the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: She premarketed her talent for painting by showcasing her artwork in local galleries.
meanings.sent5: The magician premarketed his upcoming show by performing mind-blowing tricks on the streets.

meanings.definition: Having been marketed or promoted before its official release.
meanings.sent1: The premarketed movie generated a lot of buzz before it even hit theaters.
meanings.sent2: Customers were eager to purchase the premarketed limited edition sneakers.
meanings.sent3: The premarketed cookies were so popular that they sold out before they were officially available.
meanings.sent4: The premarketed concert tickets were in such high demand that scalpers were selling them at inflated prices.
meanings.sent5: The premarketed book became a bestseller as soon as it was released due to the early promotion.
